thread.title: Hot-air balloons over Central Valley

title: Hot-air balloons over Central Valley
text:

Photo: Color The Skies Hot-air balloons Color the Skies in a benefit for local youth... Hot-air balloons over Central Valley 1 / 1 6456655|article-gallery-6456655|0 6456655|article-gallery-6456655|0 OK, so it’s not Albuquerque, but the almond-growing burg of Ripon, between Modesto and Manteca, has been taking advantage of Central Valley thermals to put on an impressive hot-air balloon festival for nine years. The Color the Skies Hot Air Balloon and Kite Festival creates a celestial kaleidoscope accompanied by skydivers, jets and a medical transport helicopter team. On the ground, tethered balloon rides, a pancake breakfast, train rides and lots of kids’ activities are available. A carnival and live music extend festivities into the evening.
Vitals: Sept. 5-6,
6 a.m.-3 p.m. Carnival Sept. 4-5, 5 p.m.-10 p.m. $20. Mistlin Sports Park, Jack Tone and River roads, Ripon. (209) 599-7519, www.colortheskies.com.
Cruising into the Deco era: The golden age of travel lives on during the Queen Mary ’s annual Art Deco Festival. The ship-turned hotel/museum is perhaps the world’s largest monument to the opulent Gatsby-era style, and the festival time-travels straight back to the days of tea dances, big bands and martinis. The ocean liner’s famous Starlight Lounge will be resurrected, and vendors will offer Deco merchandise and collectibles. Sept. 4-7; see website for schedule. $19-$189; Grand Passport $399. (562) 499-1771. www.queenmary.com.
Return of “The Birds”: Famous as the setting of Alfred Hitchcock ’s enduring 1961 thriller, Bodega Bay is offering tours of the 1873 Potter school, which played a central role. The schoolhouse is now a private home and county historic landmark, and the longtime owner will talk about its history, the filming and paranormal phenomena. (In a separate event, star Tippi Hedren will sign autographs at the Tides Wharf Restaurant at 11 a.m. all weekend, for a fee.) Sept. 6, 10 a.m.-1:30 p.m. $25. (707) (707) 823-1511, www.seb.org.
